title: Thunderbird exchange email accounts disappeared and I cannot get them back
content: All of a sudden, all my exchange accounts disappeared from both my laptop and desktop (both Mac running the latest OS). I have tried reconnecting to them but have not been able. The accounts are ok and I can access them via outlook or web browser. But I want Thunderbird back. I use the OWL plugin. The loss of accounts seems to have coincided with the latest Thunderbird release on 10 October. I'm assuming this is some kind of bug and that I'm not the only victim. Has anyone else suffered this? If so, is there a fix? Thanks Wayne
creator: wayne.m.best

title: Inserting links in Thunderbird mail causing message to freeze
content:
In the past two days I've not been able to insert a hyperlink into an email via either the link icon nor the insert navigation.

When I hit either I am no longer able to do anything with the message I am working on it freezes. I am still able to go back to the rest of my mailboxes/folders without an issue.

Anyone know if this is a known issue or what the fix might be?

Thanks in advance.
creator: smoise831

title: Can't make message list less than 1.5 inches high
content:
A few weeks ago, after upgrading to release 115 (upgraded to 115.3.2 today), I can't make the height of the message list box at the top of the screen be less than 1.5". At the previous release (112.x?) I could use the double pointer to shove the horizontal line up until the message list box contained only 4-5 lines (maybe about 1/2"-3/4" in height?). I can't go back to release 112.x to verify what the minimum height of the message list box was that I could set, but I know it was a LOT less than the 1.5" mininum height it is now.

I would like to keep the message list heght as small as possible in order to maximize the amount of space for the actual messages in the lower part of the screen. I can certainly understand why there has to be a minimum message list box height, but IMHO that minimum should be 1/4" or a max of 1/2", not 1.5" as it is now.

I would greatly appreciate it you would allow us to be able to reduce the message list height to 1/4"-1/2", or at least to the same value it was in release 112.x.

Thank you very much.

Will Hern
creator: wjh123

title: SERVERBUG
content: I have one email mailbox which generates the attached message on any windows machine I install Thunderbird on. All other email clients that I have tried work and of course webmail works. I expect that there is one email on this IMAP account which causes Thunderbird to make an invalid request of the server. I could not find anything in the normal Thunderbird log files. Is there a way to get very detailed Thunderbird log files to help narrow this down? The server is Rackspace email. I looked at their logs but they don't show operations that failed in the middle.

title: cannot login to mail account
content: I was using two accounts on Thunderbird, my company email account and a gmail account. Suddenly in this morning my company email disappeared from Thunderbird. I tried to re-setup the email, but I failed. It shows an error: Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password. (When I first setup this account, it automatically logged without setting any configuration manually.) I checked my company IT and no ammendments were made on the server settings recently.
creator: elisekang.sy

title: local messages on Thunderbird
content: I recently updated to version 115.3.2, found the layout unchangeable and displeasing. So I backtracked, installed 102.9.1. But running that, my long list of Local Folders no longer appears. Searching for help leads to solutions that do not pertain to the file structure on 102.9.1. I.e., under Local Folders, there my local folders are, but messages are contained in folders named XXX.mozmsgs, with XXX files and XXX.msf. But running the Thunderbird program does not list these local folders. Help for older versions does not apply. How can I get these Local Folders to appear when running the program? Thanks for help.
creator: nickfromiowa
